intro: Hieracium latemixtum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are broadly ovate with a rough texture, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium latemixtum is often found in temperate regions and can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies.
